snippet: The three-time Indianapolis 500 winner Dario Franchitti reluctantly retired Thursday after doctors told him it was too dangerous for him to continue racing because of the injuries he sustained in a crash last month.
abstract: Three-time Indianapolis 500 winner Dario Franchitti reluctantly retires after doctors tells him it is too dangerous for him to continue racing because of the injuries he sustained in an October crash in Houston.
lead_paragraph: The three-time Indianapolis 500 winner Dario Franchitti reluctantly retired Thursday after doctors told him it was too dangerous for him to continue racing because of the injuries he sustained in a crash last month.
